pageTitle: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau speaks with Ursula von der Leyen, President-elect of the European Commission | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Today, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau spoke with the President-elect of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen.

Prime Minister Trudeau congratulated President-elect von der Leyen on her election as the next President of the European Commission, a position she will take up on November 1, 2019.

The two leaders reaffirmed the strong relationship and shared values between Canada and the European Union, including support for multilateralism and a rules-based international order. They welcomed the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA) and the opportunities for economic growth and prosperity it presents for both Canada and the European Union. They also discussed gender equality and Prime Minister Trudeau commended President-elect von der Leyen on her plans to build a gender balanced European Commission.

The Prime Minister and President-elect von der Leyen recalled the excellent and close working relationship she enjoyed with Canada’s Minister of National Defence Harjit Singh Sajjan in her previous role as Minister of Defence of the Federal Republic of Germany.

Prime Minister Trudeau praised the close cooperation with current European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker, and reaffirmed Canada’s commitment to President-elect von der Leyen to continue deepening the partnership between Canada and the European Union on a wide range of mutual interests and in addressing current global challenges.
